answers.answer: These are serious symptoms that require a complete evaluation. They could represent serious disease of the heart, brain or blood vessels. They could be a migraine equivalent (one without headache). They could be a transient ischemic attack. (TIA).If you are older than forty, smoke, have high blood pressure, high cholesteral, diabetes, are on birthcontrol pills or have a family history of stroke-heart-neurological disease these could be a warning of serious health problems.See an ophthalmologist ASAP find one at www.aao.org  also see your personal MD for a physical with lab and other tests. Tell your physician your might have had a TIAIt is really important not to just blow this off as one of those things.JCH III MD

question: OK I was shoping today and while looking at something I started to get a weird vison problem. Thinking maybe its the bright colors I put it down and moved on. With in a few second I really couldn't see. I started to be confused and have a very lost feeling like I couldnt communicate with anyone. The flickering was like the little black spots you get right before you black out. You know how your hand or foot feels after its fallen asleep and starts to weak up?? That feeling is what I saw. It lasted for about 20 min. and now I more just dazed.
title: Flickering light (spots) in vison
